text:
Program actually works almost as expected. From dev's answer "wysiwig editors are typically using content editable html5 mode. Bug Magnet works with content editable divs." 
Yes, the plugin won't work for each and every input field, because under the hood they are different. But if you open "normal" input field like google.com search or classic old school input fields - the Bug Magnet will work!
Shows up in Chrome, but selecting options from the context menu never populates any input fields or text areas.
Everything is good but it is not starting in my chrome
After installing this tool from google chrome web store, when I right click on page, I am not able to see the option of Bug Magnet.
I can't add a config file. If I close the modal and reopen it, it's empty again
Amazing plug-in, reduces alot of effort with the test data. Higly recommended
Highly recommended this to use, while checking the boundary values and required different types of Test Data.
Extension does not work once installed.

Really useful extension. The option to add your own configuration is also very handy. 

Definitely something I use every day.
Used it for testing our dashboard of bugclipper.com and it has been very helpful. Highly recommened.
An elegant and simple solution to exploratory testing.  A handy tool that any QA Test Engineer would find useful -- highly recommended
